data.title: Museum & Attractions
data.meta_description: There is nothing better than spending a day learning more about our history and the beautiful city in which we live
data.text:
Are you a history or art aficionado, but not sure where you can scratch your itch for learning in the Dayton area? Our team are experts on the area and can assist you in finding the perfect spot to spend a morning, afternoon, or entire day. Give us a call using the number above to chat with a member of our team and let us connect you with your new favorite museum in Dayton!

The Carillon Historical Park

Carillon Historical Park is a living history museum. The park covers 65 acres and features over 30 historical buildings and exhibits that showcase the history of Dayton and the Miami Valley region. One of the highlights of the park is the Deeds Carillon, a 151-foot-tall tower that houses 57 bronze bells, making it one of the largest carillons in the world. The park also includes the Wright Brothers National Museum, which celebrates the lives and achievements of Orville and Wilbur Wright, who were Dayton natives and inventors of the first successful powered airplane. Other exhibits at the park focus on the history of Dayton's manufacturing industry, the region's role in the Underground Railroad, and the history of transportation. Visitors can explore the park on foot or take a ride on the park's replica 1835 B&O steam locomotive.

Characteristic 2

The Dayton Art Institute is a museum that showcases an impressive collection of fine art from various cultures and time periods. Founded in 1919, the museum features over 26,000 objects in its permanent collection, including paintings, sculptures, and decorative arts. One of the highlights of the museum is its extensive collection of American art, which includes works by important artists such as Edward Hopper, Grant Wood, and Georgia O'Keeffe. Additionally, the museum has notable collections of European and Asian art, as well as a strong collection of African art. The museum also offers a range of educational programs and events, including lectures, workshops, and tours. Overall, the Dayton Art Institute is a cultural gem in the Midwest, offering visitors a chance to explore and appreciate a wide range of artistic traditions from around the world.

Americaâ€™s Packard Museum

America's Packard Museum is a tribute to one of America's most iconic luxury car manufacturers, the Packard Motor Car Company. The museum houses a collection of over 50 historic Packard vehicles, including cars, trucks, and motorcycles, as well as various artifacts, photographs, and documents related to the company's history. The museum's exhibits showcase the evolution of Packard vehicles from their early days in the late 19th century to their peak in the 1930s and 1940s, as well as the challenges that the company faced during the Great Depression and World War II. Visitors can also learn about the company's contributions to aviation technology, including the development of engines for World War II fighter planes. In addition to the exhibits, the museum also offers educational programs, guided tours, and special events throughout the year.

Contact Us for More!

Our team of Dayton experts have a deep understanding of the area and the many museums and attractions that can be found here. If you are looking to engross yourself in all that Dayton has to offer in the way of history, give us a call, and not only can we recommend a hotspot to visit, but we will also get you there too!
